text:
Hi Nathan,

I believe this should work:

 `{% dnd_module`
        `path="@HubSpot/header",`
             `header_tag="h5",`
        `value="NEW HEADER"`
      `%}`
`{% module_attribute "css"  is_json=True %}`
`{`
`"color": "#CC0201",`
`"font-family": "Georgia, serif",`
`"font-size": "27px"`
`}`
`{% end_module_attribute %}`
`{% end_dnd_module %}`
Hi guys, a new fellow here who wants to learn how HubSpot CRM works. Any hints/links as starting point would be very helpful.
<@UFURR5PM3> You are my new best friend! That works! Didn't realize that setup could be used with the header module. Wish stuff like that would be in the docs. Thank you!

<@U0397BZRK6G> I didn't know for certain if it could, but made changes on a demo page and checked the developer info to see where the changes were being made. Interesting aside: you can actually add any styling you want in there (e.g. "opacity": "0.5", etc.) and it will take effect. I don't really see a practical application for that other than messing with your clients, but I find it interesting none the less :joy:

We had try to use Gravity Forms and FormStack to actual map a HubSpot Form that maps values to a contact and to a custom object, but it seems that when mapping the third party app it only capture fields at the contact level and does not map the values to the custom object. We need to had logic to the third-party app and map values for both the contact and the custom objects.
We are debating in using API calls and/or programable actions/webhooks to map the custom object fields vs using a third party tool.
hahaha! Yes, messing with clients is... good?? Maybe not, but it's funny to think about. :)
What is the best tool (i.e. Zapier) or API method to map fields from a third party app to the contact and custom objects in HubSpot?
